revised_title: Crystal Symmetry and Molecular Constitution in Organic Compounds
tldr: The author investigates the crystal symmetry and molecular constitution of various organic compounds, including ethylene, acetylene, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, phosgene, carbon oxysulphide, carbon bisulphide, methyl chloride, dichlormethane, trichlormethane, and tetrachlormethane. The study aims to understand the relationship between the crystal structures and molecular properties of these compounds.
